intro: Lellingeria dissimulans, commonly known as the false dandelion, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grassy areas and has a low, spreading habit with lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are yellow and bloom in spring, producing seeds that are dispersed by the wind. Lellingeria dissimulans is often mistaken for true dandelions due to its similar appearance.
